original: Lindström, Bror Thure Sigurd, e. o. hovpredikant, kyrkoherde, Karlshamn, f. 10/9/81 i Glemminge, Krist. 1., av biskop Herman L. o. Beata Brorström. G. 07 m. Ester Nordström. Barn: Stig f. 08, red., fil. kand., Ingvar 11, kapt. v. P.2, Olle 16, löjtn. v. 1.11. — Stud:ex. i Växjö 99, fil. kand. i Llind 02, teor. o. prakt. teol. ex. 06, prästex. o. prästv. i Växjö s. å. Domkyrkoadj. i Växjö 06, domkyrkosysslom. 07, fäng :pred. s. å., kyrkoh. i Räpplinge 19-27, tf. kyrkoh. i St. Köpinge 27-29, kyrkoh. i Frenninge o. Vollsjö 29-35, kyrkoh. i Karlshamn sed. 36, tjg. e. o. hovpred. fr. 25. Lär. v. Växjö elem:-lärov, f. fl. 07-21, insp. f. Borgholms komm. melL.sk. 22-27, insp. f. Karlshamns samrealsk. o. komm. gymn. sed. 46, sekr. i Kronob. 1. fångv:fören. 07-21, led. av styr. f. Ölands kulturm:-fören. 22-27, ordf. i Frenninge o. Vollsjö folksk:styr. 32-35, Karlshamns folksk:styr. 36-44, barnav :nd 41-44, kyrkofullm. fr. 36, led. av stadsfullm. 39-46 o. landstinget 43-46, led. av styr. f. uppfostringsanst. Ekhagen i Karlshamn sed. 45. Skr.: Biskopshemmet på Östrabo åren 95-16, Drottningen på Solliden, Ett Ölandsminne, Nils Månsson i Skumparp, ett minnesblad t. folksk. 100-årsjub. GV:sJmt, LNO.
translated:
Lindström, Bror Thure Sigurd, acting court preacher, parish priest, Karlshamn, born on 10/9/81 in Glemminge, Kristianstad County, son of bishop Herman L. and Beata Brorström. Married in 1907 to Ester Nordström. Children: Stig, born in 1908, editor, Bachelor of Arts; Ingvar, born in 1911, captain in the military; Olle, born in 1916, second lieutenant. 

Education: Student examination in Växjö in 1899, Bachelor of Arts in Lund in 1902, theoretical and practical theology examination in 1906, ordained and ordained as a priest in Växjö the same year. Cathedral assistant in Växjö in 1906, cathedral sacristan in 1907, prison chaplain in the same year. Parish priest in Räpplinge from 1919 to 1927, acting parish priest in St. Köpinge from 1927 to 1929, parish priest in Frenninge and Vollsjö from 1929 to 1935, parish priest in Karlshamn since 1936, serving as acting court preacher from 1925. 

Teacher at Växjö elementary school from 1907 to 1921, inspector for Borgholm municipality's middle school from 1922 to 1927, inspector for Karlshamn municipal secondary school and grammar school since 1946, secretary of the Kronoberg County Prisoner Welfare Association from 1907 to 1921, member of the board of the Öland Cultural Association from 1922 to 1927, chairman of Frenninge and Vollsjö elementary school board from 1932 to 1935, Karlshamn elementary school board from 1936 to 1944, child welfare board from 1941 to 1944, church council member since 1936, member of the city council from 1939 to 1946 and county council from 1943 to 1946, member of the board of the Ekhagen upbringing institution in Karlshamn since 1945. 

Writings: "Biskopshemmet på Östrabo åren 95-16" (The Bishop's Residence at Östrabo from 1895 to 1916), "Drottningen på Solliden" (The Queen at Solliden), "Ett Ölandsminne" (A Memory of Öland), "Nils Månsson i Skumparp, ett minnesblad t. folksk. 100-årsjub. GV:sJmt, LNO" (Nils Månsson in Skumparp, a memorial for the primary school's 100th anniversary).
